document.name: Slow Tide at The Conservatory
document.short_description:
Slow Tide at The Conservatory

Interpreting the Indian coastline in 5 plates


Slow Tide, once a small fishing enclave, geographically, and socially, withdrawn from mainstreams of otherworldliness. Discovered and embraced by a global gathering, bringing about the ‘Anjuna Commune’. Free spirits, making their way across exotic Asia on an adventure-filled land route, seeking the unconventional. Growing up here, ‘Anjunkars’ understand that it’s okay to live a life others don’t understand. 

Founded by Neil Dsouza, a Goan living in Bombay who moved back to Goa during the pandemic. Slow Tide, conceived during the pandemic redefines the Anjuna Shack. The successful revival of Anjuna's hippie culture by award-winning Architect Palinda Kannangara is reflected in the space, which changes "Fable" to "Table." Born in Rajagiriya, Sri Lanka, Palinda’s contextual sensitivity and experimental use of material carried our story forward. Inspired by frequent stays with us over the years, the site has become a generator of all ideas, designs never frozen but continuing to evolve. 


Vegetarian Menu

Pineapple & Grapes Sasam

Chilli-Lime Rubbed Pineapple & Grapes Sasam Salad with Curried Cashew Sauce & Caramel Rice Puff


Brussels Sprouts & Pumpkin Thoran Tostada

Brussels Sprouts & Pumpkin Thoran with Fermented Bean Pure & Poppy Seeds Crumble


Chiapas Grilled New Corn

Charred New Corn with Borracha New Cron with Goat cheese, Pickled lime Salsa & Puffed Jowar


Wild Mushroom Caldine Momos

Wild Mushroom Momos with Caldine Curry, Radish-Peanut Oistou & Lime Oil


Puran-Coconut Pataleo

Gram & Coconut Pataleo with Jaggery caramel Sauce & Almond Granola


Non- Vegetarian Menu

Red Snapper Crudo

Red Snapper Ceviche with Chilli-Tamarind Sauce & Seaweed Rice Crisp


Back Waters Crab Cake

Green Pepper & Betel Leaf Spiced Crab Cake with Cilantro-Green Apple Chutney & Recheado Aioli


Ceylon Pork Curry Taco

Sri lankan Blackened Spiced Pork Belly Curry & Pol Roti With Sambol


Mutton Alooni Bhaat

Goan Mutton (Meat & Bone) Stew with Indrayani Rice Khichadi & Muttton Pickle


Puran-Coconut Pataleo

Gram & Coconut Pataleo with Jaggery caramel Sauce & Almond Granola

document.short_description:
Woodcut Printing Beginners Workshop - by Studio Sakura


We’ll be teaching a black and white composition. If you have a composition in mind that you want to work on, you can get the sketch or a print out of it. If you don’t have anything specific in mind, you can choose from the references we have.


You take home your carved block with 1 print. If you wish to print more editions, you can print it at our studio using our etching press in Brigade road. 🖼️


✨All the materials will be provided. The tools will be provided only for use. 


No prior experience required, we will teach you from scratch.

Join us to unleash your creativity and experience the magic of printmaking.


Studio Sakura- Art Studio

Run by artists Monica & Kapila. Follow them on Instagram @studiosakura.blr

document.name: Letterpress Printing
document.short_description:
This is a beginner-friendly, creative workshop to introduce you to the world of letterpress printing – the oldest traditional form of relief printing. This 500-year-old printing method was used to make the very first books and newspapers.


After a brief foray into the pleasingly tactile, analogue world of letterpress printing, you’ll be taken through its history, background and all the niche terms involved. Dabble in some old-fashioned typesetting, learn to compose metal type and print your own piece of typographic art using a 90-year-old tabletop printing press to produce mini card prints!


Note: This workshop is designed for a small group of around 20 individuals, All necessary materials will be provided at the event venue.

document.cancellation_policy:
Refunds:

Refunds will be issued only in cases where the event is cancelled by the organizers. Refund requests made by attendees will be considered up to 2 days prior to the event date. A processing fee may apply to refund requests initiated by attendees. Refunds will be processed within 2 business days after approval.

Cancellations:

Attendees must notify the organizers of any cancellations at least 2 days before the event date. Cancellations made after the specified deadline may not be eligible for a refund. The organizers reserve the right to cancel or reschedule the event due to unforeseen circumstances. In such cases, attendees will be notified promptly, and refunds will be issued accordingly.

Transfer of Tickets:

Tickets are non-transferable without prior approval from the organizers. Requests for ticket transfers must be made in writing and approved by the organizers.

No-show Policy:

Attendees who do not show up for the event without prior notice will not be eligible for a refund. By registering for the event, attendees agree to abide by the refund and cancellation policy outlined above. The organizers reserve the right to amend or update this policy as necessary.

document.name: Bombay Style Breakfast with Strangers.
document.short_description:
Welcome to our Bombay Breakfast Table, where the day begins with delicious food and delightful conversation! Nestled in the heart of Bangalore, our gathering offers a warm and inviting atmosphere to kick-start your morning on a high note.


As you step into our cozy venue, take a seat and indulge in a hearty breakfast spread. In essence, a Bombay-style breakfast is a delightful amalgamation of flavors and culinary traditions, offering something for every palate, from savory to sweet, light to hearty.


But our Bombay Breakfast Table is about more than just the food – it's about fostering connections and building community. Strike up a conversation with fellow attendees as you sip on your favorite morning brew, sharing stories, ideas, and laughter in the company of like-minded individuals.


Whether you're here to network, unwind, or simply enjoy a delicious meal, our Bombay Breakfast Table promises a welcoming environment where you can start your day off right. So grab a plate, pour yourself a cup of cutting chai, and join us as we toast to new beginnings and the simple joy of good food and great company. Cheers to a wonderful morning ahead!

document.short_description:
Letterpress Printmaking Workshop by PRINTING WITH TYPES


Come & Experience the art of letterpress with us at love OORU, a cosy rooftop located at Koramangala. A bespoke workshop to get to know about letterpress - history, process and craft of printing by hand on an antique press. The session will focus on hand setting the metal type the old fashioned way, making a composition and printing your own piece of typographic art.


- Beginner level workshop. 

- No prior experience needed. 

- All tools would be provided for use only.


- Printed article can be carried along, materials and types will be provided for workshop use only - not to take home.

document.cancellation_policy:
Terms and Conditions:


1. Entry: Valid ticket required; keep your wine glass throughout; entry between 11am – 10pm on 22nd - 23rd June.

2. Age Restrictions: Must be 21+ with valid ID for wine tastings.

3. Coupon Use: Each coupon valid for one tasting; non-transferable and non-redeemable for cash.

4. Conduct: Organizers may refuse entry or remove intoxicated/inappropriate attendees; drink responsibly.

5. Purchases: Additional wines and foods available at special prices; pay directly at counters.

6. Personal Belongings: Organizers not liable for loss, damage, or theft of personal items.

7. Cancellations and Refunds: Tickets non-refundable; full refund if event is canceled by organizers.

8. Photography and Media: Attendees consent to being photographed/filmed for promotional use.

9. Liability: Organizers not responsible for any injuries, accidents, or damages during the event.


By purchasing a ticket, attendees agree to these terms and conditions. Enjoy UnWined responsibly and let the future speak wine!

document.name: Unwine'd - Wine Festival
document.short_description:
Unwine'd by The Blend Community


Date: 22nd - 23rd June  

Timings: 11am – 10pm  

Venue: Pebbles, Bangalore   


Pouring Over the Details: 

Join us for Unwine'd, an exclusive wine festival in Bangalore that promises an immersive experience with multiple wines from across the globe. Delight in unique wine styles, regional offerings, and exquisite gourmet food pairings. This vibrant event is filled with themed activities, fun games, and live entertainment. Each attendee receives a beautiful wine glass souvenir and tasting coupons for all showcased wines. Engage with fellow wine enthusiasts, partake in educational workshops, and create unforgettable memories.


Highlights:

- Wine Tastings: Sample a diverse range of wines from local and international vineyards.

- Gourmet Pairings: Enjoy artisanal cheeses, chocolates, and gourmet foods.

- Live Music: Dance and relax to foot-tapping music.

- Workshops & Seminars: Learn from wine experts in engaging sessions.

- Artisanal Crafts: Explore handcrafted goods and wine accessories.

- Relaxation Zones: Unwind in scenic, comfortable seating areas.


Special Experiences:

- Grape Stomping: Channel your inner winemaker.

- DIY Wine Cocktails: Create custom wine-based drinks.

- Celebrity Chef's Tables: Enjoy culinary journeys with renowned chefs.

- Wine Blending: Craft your unique wine blend.


Join us at Unwine'd for a celebration of wine, culture, and community. Let the future speak wine!

document.short_description:
Pasta Shop at The Conservatory!


Our glasshouse is transforming into a pasta shop for just two days. Experience pastas like never before from our menu featuring different types of handcrafted pastas curated by Chef Goku.


Chef Goku is a graduate of The Culinary Institute of America. He has worked at Dominique Ansel Bakery, Aureole, The Clock Tower, Junoon, Rezdora in New York, and Blackbird in Chicago. Currently, he conducts pop-ups and curated dinners in Chennai under the brand name Hygge By Chef Goku. Additionally, he oversees the pastry kitchens Chokolat Culture and Maison Indulgence.


MENU FOR THE PASTA SHOP


ANTIPASTI

 

Stracciatella Incontra Togo (Rs. 490)

Stracciatella Cheese, Togo Tomatoes, Heirloom Cherry Tomato Confit, Basil Oil, BalsamicReduction, Orange wedges, Arugula Served with Fett’ Unta.

 

Cacio E Pepe Wedge Salad  (Rs. 420)

Lettuce Wedge, Pecorino Dressing, Cracked Black Pepper.

 

Passatelli In Brodo (Rs. 420)

Parmesan Broth, Passatelli, White Truffle Oil, Cracked Black Pepper.

  

PASTA 

 

Tagliatelle Al Ragu (Rs. 770)

From Modena (Chef’s Special Short Rib Ragu).

 

Garganelli Al Ragu (Rs. 700) (V)

From Napoli (Chef’s Special Neapolitan Mushroom Ragu).

 

Strozzapreti (Rs. 665)

Creamy Tuscan Sauce with Chicken and Sun-Dried Tomato.

 

Anolini Di Parma (Rs. 770)

Traditional Lamb Meat Filling with Parmigiano Reggiano Sauce, Balsamic Reduction.
